page.title: 03THE RIVER THAMES
page.content:
The River Thames is very popular for cruising,fishing,canoeists, sailing,swimming and walking.
Some of the most common fish are Barbel,Bleat,Chub,Carp,Minnow,Rudd, Perch,Trout and Rainbow trout.
During our survey we observed the following birds: Canada Geese,Coot, Heron,Mallard,Mute swan,Great Crested Grebe,Pied Wagtail,Cormorant and Reed Bunting.
The section of the River Thames at Goring and Streatley is very wide. About 250 metres and is crossed by a bridge built in 1922 of concrete but looks wooden. Many small cruisers, which can be hired,pass under this bridge.
